intro: Labordia tinifolia var. microgyna, commonly known as the small-fruited labordia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
